thread.title: One reception separates Ravens' Steve Smith Sr., Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald
thread.title_full: One reception separates Ravens' Steve Smith Sr., Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald

author: Alexander Pyles
title: One reception separates Ravens' Steve Smith Sr., Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald
text:
One reception separates Ravens' Steve Smith Sr., Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald Steve Smith Sr. and Larry Fitzgerald Nick Wass and Don Wright/Associated Press 
Ravens wide receiver Steve Smith Sr. (951 career catches) and Arizona Cardinals wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald (952 catches) are neck-and-neck on the all-time receptions list. 
Ravens wide receiver Steve Smith Sr. (951 career catches) and Arizona Cardinals wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald (952 catches) are neck-and-neck on the all-time receptions list. (Nick Wass and Don Wright/Associated Press) Alexander Pyles Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun Ravens WR Steve Smith Sr. and Cardinals WR Larry Fitzgerald are neck-and-neck on the all-time receptions list. 
They won't meet on the field tonight, but Ravens wide receiver Steve Smith Sr. and Arizona Cardinals wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald are competing nonetheless. 
Fitzgerald, 32, has 952 career receptions. Smith, 36 and perhaps in his last NFL season, has 951. 
Assuming Smith decides to retire after this season -- he announced that intention before the season began and has told reporters that plan remains "on schedule" -- the younger Fitzgerald will almost certainly finish his career with more catches than Smith. 
That doesn't mean the Ravens' best receiver can't finish this season on top of Fitzgerald. The pair are among four NFL pass-catchers (San Francisco's Anquan Boldin and Dallas' Jason Witten are the others) within striking distance of 1,000 career catches this season. 
Just 10 receivers have that many; Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Hines Ward (1,000 catches) was the last player to join the club, in 2011. 
Smith and Fitzgerald are having outstanding seasons. Smith, despite missing one game, leads the Ravens in receiving with 36 catches, 510 yards and three touchdowns. Fitzgerald last had 1,000 receiving yards in a season in 2011, but is well on his way this year: he's caught 43 passes for 583 yards and six touchdowns.
